DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Positive Surgical Margin Other Patient Orientation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:definition pending_Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Position or alignment relative to points of the compass or other specific directions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
Indicates the presence of tumor cells at the edge of a surgically excised specimen.
